Legal_Issue: Whether the Visa Officer failed to conduct an individualized assessment and breached procedural fairness
Evidence_Assessment: Medical Officer assessed Carlos generically as deaf; Applicant provided evidence of minimal support needs but lacked detailed funding plan
Decision_Outcome: Visa officer denied permanent residence based on potential excessive demand
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate no excessive demand
Legal_Rule: A foreign national is inadmissible under s. 38(1)(c) IRPA if their health condition might reasonably cause excessive demand on health or social services
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide clear notice requiring a detailed funding plan
Grounds_for_Claim: Unreasonable assessment, breach of procedural fairness
Outcome_on_Merits: Visa officer's decision found unreasonable and procedurally unfair
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Breach found due to inadequate communication in procedural fairness letters
Key_Evidence_Considered: Cochlear implant success, lack of detailed funding plan
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged denial of permanent residence for son based on medical inadmissibility
Court_Result: Judicial review granted, decision quashed, remanded for reassessment
Outcome: Decision set aside, case remanded for reassessment
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Excessive demand on health or social services due to medical condition
